pacman.game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • pacman.game.Game

  • public final class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The implementation of Ms Pac-Man. This class contains the game engine and all methods required to query the state of the game. First, the mazes are loaded once only as they are immutable. The game then proceeds to initialise all variables using default values. The game class also provides numerous methods to extract the game state as a string (used for replays and for communication via pipes during the competition) and to create copies. Care has been taken to implement the game efficiently to ensure that copies can be created quickly. The game has a central update method called advanceGame which takes a move for Ms Pac-Man and up to 4 moves for the ghosts. It then updates the positions of all characters, check whether pills or power pills have been eaten and updates the game state accordingly. All other methods are to access the gamestate and to compute numerous aspects such as directions to taken given a target or a shortest path from a to b. All shortest path distances from any node to any other node are pre-computed and loaded from file. This makes these methods more efficient. Note about the ghosts: ghosts are not allowed to reverse. Hence it is not possible to simply look up the shortest path distance. Instead, one can approximate this greedily or use A* to compute it properly. The former is somewhat quicker and has a low error rate. The latter takes a bit longer but is absolutely accurate. We use the pre-computed shortest path distances as admissable heuristic so it is very efficient.

    • Field Detail

      • caches

        public static PathsCache[] caches

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(long seed)
        Instantiates a new game. The seed is used to initialise the pseudo-random number generator. This way, a game may be replicated exactly by using identical seeds. Note: in the competition, the games received from the game server are using different seeds. Otherwise global reversal events would be predictable.
        Parameters:
        seed - The seed for the pseudo-random number generator

      • Game

        public Game(long seed,
            int initialMaze)
        Initiates a new game specifying the maze to start with.
        Parameters:
        seed - Seed used for the pseudo-random numbers
        initialMaze - The maze to start the game with

    • Method Detail

      • getGameState

        public java.lang.String getGameState()
        Gets the game state as a string: all variables are written to a string in a pre-determined order. The string may later be used to recreate a game state using the setGameState() method. Variables not included: enableGlobalReversals
        Returns:
        The game state as a string

      • setGameState

        public void setGameState(java.lang.String gameState)
        Sets the game state from a string: the inverse of getGameState(). It reconstructs all the game's variables from the string.
        Parameters:
        gameState - The game state represented as a string

      • copy

        public Game copy()
        Returns an exact copy of the game. This may be used for forward searches such as minimax. The copying is relatively efficient.
        Returns:
        the game

      • advanceGame

        public void advanceGame(Constants.MOVE pacManMove,
                        java.util.EnumMap<Constants.GHOST,Constants.MOVE> ghostMoves)
        Central method that advances the game state using the moves supplied by the controllers. It first updates Ms Pac-Man, then the ghosts and then the general game logic.
        Parameters:
        pacManMove - The move supplied by the Ms Pac-Man controller
        ghostMoves - The moves supplied by the ghosts controller

      • updateGame

        public void updateGame()
        Updates the game once the individual characters have been updated: check if anyone can eat anyone else. Then update the lair times and check if Ms Pac-Man should be awarded the extra live. Then update the time and see if the level or game is over.

      • updateGame

        public void updateGame(boolean feast,
                       boolean updateLairTimes,
                       boolean updateExtraLife,
                       boolean updateTotalTime,
                       boolean updateLevelTime)
        This method is for specific purposes such as searching a tree in a specific manner. It has to be used cautiously as it might create an unstable game state and may cause the game to crash.
        Parameters:
        feast - Whether or not to enable feasting
        updateLairTimes - Whether or not to update the lair times
        updateExtraLife - Whether or not to update the extra life
        updateTotalTime - Whether or not to update the total time
        updateLevelTime - Whether or not to update the level time

      • getNeighbour

        public int getNeighbour(int nodeIndex,
                        Constants.MOVE moveToBeMade)
        Given a node index and a move to be made, it returns the node index the move takes one to. If there is no neighbour in that direction, the method returns -1.
        Parameters:
        nodeIndex - The current node index
        moveToBeMade - The move to be made
        Returns:
        The node index of the node the move takes one to

      • getMoveToMakeToReachDirectNeighbour

        public Constants.MOVE getMoveToMakeToReachDirectNeighbour(int currentNodeIndex,
                                                          int neighbourNodeIndex)
        Method that returns the direction to take given a node index and an index of a neighbouring node. Returns null if the neighbour is invalid.
        Parameters:
        currentNodeIndex - The current node index.
        neighbourNodeIndex - The direct neighbour (node index) of the current node.
        Returns:
        the move to make to reach direct neighbour

                                int toNodeIndex)
        Returns the MANHATTAN distance between two nodes in the current mazes[gs.curMaze].
        Parameters:
        fromNodeIndex - the from node index
        toNodeIndex - the to node index
        Returns:
        the manhattan distance

      • getApproximateNextMoveTowardsTarget

        public Constants.MOVE getApproximateNextMoveTowardsTarget(int fromNodeIndex,
                                                          int toNodeIndex,
                                                          Constants.MOVE lastMoveMade,
                                                          Constants.DM distanceMeasure)
        Gets the approximate next move towards target not considering directions opposing the last move made.
        Parameters:
        fromNodeIndex - The node index from which to move (i.e., current position)
        toNodeIndex - The target node index
        lastMoveMade - The last move made
        distanceMeasure - The distance measure required (Manhattan, Euclidean or Straight line)
        Returns:
        The approximate next move towards target (chosen greedily)

      • getApproximateNextMoveAwayFromTarget

        public Constants.MOVE getApproximateNextMoveAwayFromTarget(int fromNodeIndex,
                                                           int toNodeIndex,
                                                           Constants.MOVE lastMoveMade,
                                                           Constants.DM distanceMeasure)

        Parameters:
        fromNodeIndex - The node index from which to move (i.e., current position)
        toNodeIndex - The target node index
        lastMoveMade - The last move made
        distanceMeasure - The distance measure required (Manhattan, Euclidean or Straight line)
        Returns:
        The approximate next move towards target (chosen greedily)

      • getNextMoveTowardsTarget

        public Constants.MOVE getNextMoveTowardsTarget(int fromNodeIndex,
                                               int toNodeIndex,
                                               Constants.MOVE lastMoveMade,
                                               Constants.DM distanceMeasure)

        toNodeIndex - The target node index
        lastMoveMade - The last move made
        distanceMeasure - the distance measure to be used

        the next move towards target

                                      Constants.MOVE lastMoveMade)

        Gets the A* path considering previous moves made (i.e., opposing actions are ignored)

        toNodeIndex - The target node index

                             int toNodeIndex)

        Parameters:
        fromNodeIndex - The node index from where to start (i.e., current position)
        toNodeIndex - The target node index

      • getApproximateShortestPath

        @Deprecated
public int[] getApproximateShortestPath(int fromNodeIndex,
                                                    int toNodeIndex,
                                                    Constants.MOVE lastMoveMade)
        Deprecated. use getShortestPath() instead.
        Gets the approximate shortest path taking into account the last move made (i.e., no reversals). This is approximate only as the path is computed greedily. A more accurate path can be obtained using A* which is slightly more costly.
        Parameters:
        fromNodeIndex - The node index from where to start (i.e., current position)
        toNodeIndex - The target node index
        lastMoveMade - The last move made
        Returns:
        the shortest path from start to target

      • getShortestPath

        public int[] getShortestPath(int fromNodeIndex,
                             int toNodeIndex,
                             Constants.MOVE lastMoveMade)
        Gets the shortest path taking into account the last move made (i.e., no reversals). This is approximate only as the path is computed greedily. A more accurate path can be obtained using A* which is slightly more costly.
        Parameters:
        fromNodeIndex - The node index from where to start (i.e., current position)
        toNodeIndex - The target node index
        lastMoveMade - The last move made
        Returns:
        the shortest path from start to target

      • getApproximateShortestPathDistance

        @Deprecated
public int getApproximateShortestPathDistance(int fromNodeIndex,
                                                          int toNodeIndex,
                                                          Constants.MOVE lastMoveMade)
        Deprecated. use getShortestPathDistance() instead.
        Similar to getApproximateShortestPath but returns the distance of the path only. It is slightly more efficient.
        Parameters:
        fromNodeIndex - The node index from where to start (i.e., current position)
        toNodeIndex - The target node index
        lastMoveMade - The last move made
        Returns:
        the exact distance of the path
